edu.stanford.math.plex4.io

Class FileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.io.FileManager

  • public class FileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class returns canonical paths so that they are in the appropriate format for the OS in use (e.g. / in linux vs. \ in windows). We use the following terminology: Base output path: "./data/runs" Daily output path: "./data/runs/yyMMdd" Unique output path: "./data/runs/yyMMdd/HHmmssSSS" Category output path: "./data/runs/yyMMdd/" Unique Category output path: ".data/runs/yyMMdd//HHmmssSSS" With regard to filenames we use the following terminology: Suppose we have the file "output.txt", the basename is "output", the extention is "txt" and the filename is "output.txt". We call the filepath its path along with the filename, e.g. "./data/runs/yyMMdd/cat1/output.txt".
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz, Tim Harrington

      • generateUniqueFileName

        public static java.lang.String generateUniqueFileName()
        This function creates a unique filename. It is actually of the form yyMMddHHmmssSSS. The filename does not have any extension.
        Returns:
        a filename of the form yyMMddHHmmssSSS
